intro: Hieracium cernuum, commonly known as the nodding hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow with a central disk, and the leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped. It is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
